abstract: The Pipeline fellows have decided to invest $105,000 in a for-profit, socially conscious company called PhilanTech.
snippet: The Pipeline fellows have decided to invest $105,000 in a for-profit, socially conscious company called PhilanTech.
lead_paragraph: Since April, I've followed the progress of the first class of Pipeline Fellowship fellows, 10 women who learned how to become angel investors during a six-month program, and then chose a company to receive their pooled investment. When I last checked in with them, they had narrowed the field of possible companies to three -- all of which were for-profit, woman-led, and socially conscious, as required by Pipeline.
